intro: Carum triradiatum, commonly known as three-rayed caraway, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Carum triradiatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
